Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.game.models.entities.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
BotPlayer
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the game, with position, power-ups, state, movement timing, and the ability to place bombs.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Player.State
    Enum representing the possible states of a player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int startRow, int startCol, Player.State state)
      Constructs a player with a starting position and initial state.
      Parameters:
      startRow - Starting row on the game grid.
      startCol - Starting column on the game grid.
      state - Initial state of the player (ALIVE, DEAD, or GHOST).

  • Method Details

    • tryPlaceBomb

      public void tryPlaceBomb(int row, int col, Bomb bomb)
      Attempts to place a bomb if the cooldown allows.
      Parameters:
      row - The row at which to place the bomb.
      col - The column at which to place the bomb.
      bomb - The bomb to be placed.

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Returns:
      The current row of the player.

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Returns:
      The current column of the player.

    • setPower

      public void setPower(PowerUp.Power power, long now, long duration, Bomb bomb)
      Assigns a power-up to the player for a certain duration.
      Parameters:
      power - The power-up to apply.
      now - Current time in nanoseconds.
      duration - Duration of the power-up effect.
      bomb - The bomb object affected by some power-ups.

    • getPower

      public PowerUp.Power getPower()
      Returns:
      The player's current power-up.

    • removePower

      public void removePower(Bomb bomb)
      Removes the player's current power-up and resets all related attributes.
      Parameters:
      bomb - The bomb object to reset range if applicable.

    • getPowerEndTime

      public long getPowerEndTime()
      Returns:
      The time (in nanoseconds) at which the current power expires.

    • move

      public void move(int dRow, int dCol)
      Moves the player by the specified delta.
      Parameters:
      dRow - Change in row.
      dCol - Change in column.

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove(long now)
      Checks if the player can move based on the current time and movement delay.
      Parameters:
      now - Current time in nanoseconds.
      Returns:
      true if the player can move, false otherwise.

    • updateLastMoveTime

      public void updateLastMoveTime(long now)
      Updates the time when the player last moved.
      Parameters:
      now - Current time in nanoseconds.

    • setMoveDelay

      public void setMoveDelay(long delay)
      Sets the player's movement delay based on the game speed.
      Parameters:
      delay - The delay between moves in nanoseconds.

    • getMoveDelay

      public long getMoveDelay()
      Returns:
      The current delay between player movements.

    • setState

      public void setState(Player.State state)
      Sets the player's state (e.g. ALIVE, DEAD, GHOST).
      Parameters:
      state - The new state to assign.

    • getState

      public Player.State getState()
      Returns:
      The current state of the player.

    • setPlacementSpeed

      public void setPlacementSpeed(float placementSpeed)
      Sets the bomb placement speed modifier.
      Parameters:
      placementSpeed - The new placement speed factor.

    • getPlacementSpeed

      public float getPlacementSpeed()
      Returns:
      The current bomb placement speed modifier.

    • appliPower

      public void appliPower(Bomb bomb)
      Applies the player's current power-up effects.
      Parameters:
      bomb - The bomb object affected by power-ups.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Sets the player's score.
      Parameters:
      score - The new score value.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns:
      The current score of the player.

    • setBombDelay

      public void setBombDelay(double delay)
      Sets the delay between bomb placements.
      Parameters:
      delay - The delay in seconds (or game time units) before the player can place another bomb.

    • getBombDelay

      public double getBombDelay()
      Gets the current delay between bomb placements.
      Returns:
      The bomb placement delay.

    • getPlayerConnected

      public boolean getPlayerConnected()
      Returns whether the player is currently connected.
      Returns:
      true if the player is connected; false otherwise.

    • setPlayerConnected

      public void setPlayerConnected(boolean playerConnected)
      Sets the player's connection status.
      Parameters:
      playerConnected - true if the player is connected; false otherwise.

    • setCanPlaceBomb

      public void setCanPlaceBomb(boolean canPlaceBomb)
      Sets whether the player can place bombs.
      Parameters:
      canPlaceBomb - true if the player is allowed to place bombs; false otherwise.
